text: The North Zone women's cricket team is a women's first-class cricket team that represents North India in the Inter Zone Women's One Day Competition and Inter Zone Women's Three Day Competition. Team also represented North India in the now defunct Rani Jhansi Trophy from 1974 to 1997. North zone being only team apart from central zone to win the one day tournament, when they won it in season 2011–12. ==Current squad== {| class="wikitable" !Name !Domestic team !Birth date !Batting Style !Bowling Style !Notes |- |Taniya Bhatia (wk) |Punjab Women |28 November 1997 |Right-hand batsman | | |- |Preeti Bose |Haryana Women |20 April 1990 |Right-hand batsman |Slow left-arm orthodox | |- |Neha Chauhan |Himachal Pradesh Women |8 February 1995 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm off-break | |- |Neena Choudhary |Himachal Pradesh Women |24 March 1991 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm off-break | |- |Harleen Deol |Himachal Pradesh Women |21 June 1998 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm off-break | |- |Mansi Joshi |Haryana Women |18 August 1993 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm medium pace | |- |Mehak Kesar |Punjab Women |15 December 1992 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm off-break | |- |Sonia Khatri (wk) |Haryana Women |4 December 1993 |Right-hand batsman | | |- |Latika Kumari |Delhi Women |5 January 1982 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm medium pace | |- |Reema Malhotra |Delhi Women |17 October 1980 |Right-hand batsman |Leg-break | |- |Babita Negi |Delhi Women |12 March 1989 |Left-hand batsman |Left-arm | |- |Priya Punia |Delhi Women |6 August 1996 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm medium pace | |- |Renuka Singh |Himachal Pradesh Women |2 January 1996 |Right-hand batsman |Right-arm medium pace | |- |Soni Yadav |Delhi Women |25 March 1994 |Right- hand batsman |Right-arm medium pace | |} ==References== == External links == * North Zone women's at cricketarchive Category:Indian women's first-class cricket teams
